Reading Queue - 2019

04 Jan 2019

I am convinced that following the urge for the latest news, content, and even to some extent ideas is not the best we can do. My best guess is that the latest news was somehow very important to our tribal ancestors. But currently we really don’t need news at all - we are not all traders needing the latest information to beat the market, nor does the news tell us anything new about the people interact with. And while you might argue that consuming the news gives you stuff to talk to with others, so does not consuming it. “I haven’t read the news in a while. What is going on? I am truly interested.”

With out any further bullshit preamble here is my reading list for 2019:

Reading Porn

  • 52 things I learned in 2018 - Kent Hendricks

  • 52 things I learned in 2018 – Fluxx Studio Notes – Medium

  • It’s probably time to learn Chinese – Eric Meltzer – Medium

  • Tyler Cowen’s 12 rules for life - Marginal REVOLUTION

  • Opinion: It’s Westworld. What’s Wrong With Cruelty to Robots? - The New York Times

  • Do the Rich Capture All the Gains from Economic Growth?

  • One Giant Step for a Chess-Playing Machine - The New York Times

  • 31 lessons from startups doing it better than you – Fluxx Studio Notes – Medium

  • P Krugman - How I Work

  • Paul Graham - Essays

Inspiration / Humanism

  • The Best of Brain Pickings 2018 – Brain Pickings

  • The Best of Farnam Street 2018 - fs.blog

  • The Best of Brain Pickings 2017 – Brain Pickings

  • The Best of Farnam Street 2017

Series

  • LessWrong 2.0

  • Effective Altruism - Career Guide

Long Form (To be enjoyed over coffee)

  • Essays - Gwern.net

  • How to Pick a Career (That Actually Fits You)

  • Neuralink and the Brain’s Magical Future

  • The Marriage Decision: Everything Forever or Nothing Ever Again

  • The Fermi Paradox

  • Everything You Don’t Know About Tipping

  • How to Beat Procrastination

  • 20 Things I Learned While I Was in North Korea

  • Why Generation Y Yuppies Are Unhappy

  • Gluten Free Antarctica - idlewords.com

  • Navalism — Quotes & Perceptions by Naval Ravikant

  • Money, blockchains, and social scalability

Journalism / Culture / Politics/ Gossip

  • Andrew Sullivan: America’s New Religions

  • Andrew Sullivan on the Opioid Epidemic in America

  • Political tribalism in Trump’s America: what Andrew Sullivan gets wrong - Vox

  • Sam Harris and the Myth of Perfectly Rational Thought: WIRED

  • Why Sam Harris—Not Ezra Klein—Is the One Making Space for People of Colour - Quillette

Crypto Stuff

  • Vitalik Buterin’s website

  • The Subjectivity / Exploitability Tradeoff

  • Proof of Stake: How I Learned to Love Weak Subjectivity

  • Build a simple Ethereum + InterPlanetary File System (IPFS)+ React.js DApp.

  • Hayek in the Machine - Marginal REVOLUTION

  • Ethereum Plans to Cut Its Absurd Energy Consumption by 99 Percent - IEEE Spectrum

  • Unsolved Problems in Blockchain Sharding – NEAR Protocol – Medium

  • State of Stablecoins, 2018 – ConsenSys Media

  • Analysis of the DAO exploit

  • How does Ethereum work, anyway? – Preethi Kasireddy – Medium

  • Fundamental questions around web3/blockchain value… - Evan Van Ness
